Name: ORZ GTX ABX BARICITINIB GTUBE NURSING INSTRUCT
WordProcessing1: Nursing: Baricitinib G Tube Administration Instructions   Administration via gastrostomy feeding tube: For patients with a gastrostomy feeding tube, tablets for the desired dose may be placed into a container with approximately 15 ml (10 ml minimum) of room temperature water and dispersed with gentle swirling.    Ensure the tablet(s) are sufficiently dispersed to allow free passage through the tip of the syringe. Withdraw entire contents from the container into an appropriate syringe and immediately administer through the gastric feeding tube.   Rinse container with approximately 15 ml (10 ml minimum) of room temperature water, withdraw the contents into the syringe, and administer  through the tube.
DisplayText: Baricitinib G Tube Administration Nursing Instructions
SecondaryDisplayText: Baricitinib G Tube Administration Nursing Instructions

Name: ORZ GTX ABX BARICITINIB NG NURSING INSTRUCT
WordProcessing1: Nursing: Baricitinib NG Administration Instructions   Administration via nasogastric feeding tube: For patients with an enteral feeding tube, tablets for the desired dose may be placed into a container with approximately 30 mL of room temperature water and dispersed with gentle swirling.   Ensure the tablet(s) are sufficiently dispersed to allow free passage through the tip of the syringe. Withdraw the entire contents from the container into an appropriate syringe and immediately administer through the enteral feeding tube. To avoid clogging of small diameter tubes (smaller than 12 Fr), the syringe can be held horizontally and shaken during administration.   Rinse container with a sufficient amount (minimum of 15 mL) of room temperature water, withdraw the contents into the syringe, and administer through the tube.

ORZ GTX ABX INV SOTROVIMAB NURSING INSTRUCT
WordProcessing1: Nursing: Inv-Sotrovimab Infusion Administration Instructions: *Use a 0.2 micron inline filter during administration. Special tubing not required.* Attach infusion set to the IV bag. Prime the infusion set. Administer entire infusion solution in bag via IV pump. Once infusion is complete, flush infusion line with 0.9% sodium chloride (NS) to ensure delivery of required dose. If infusion must be discontinued for an infusion reaction, discard any unused product. If refrigerated, allow to warm to room temperature for approximately 15 minutes prior to administration.  Clinically monitor patient during infusion and observe patient for at least 1 hour after infusion is complete. Monitor vital signs at baseline and every 15 minutes during infusion. Monitor for infusion-related reactions (eg, fever, chills, hypotension, rash, pruritis) and hypersensitivity/anaphylaxis. Slow or stop infusion and treat as appropriate if an infusion-related reaction occurs.

Name: ORZ GTX ABX TIX-CIL NURSING INSTRUCTIONS
WordProcessing1: Nursing: Inv-Cilgavimab + Inv-Tixagevimab Administration Instructions (EVUSHELD) Instructions: 1) Give patient Fact Sheet for Patients/Caregivers for the medication. 2) Complete pre-screening questions template in CPRS for the medication.  3) Pharmacy will dispense the medication in the original kit (contains both medications in 2 separate vials) to the clinic labeled per patient. 4) Store medication in refrigerator until patient appointment time. 5) Do NOT puncture vials until ready to administer to patient.  5) The medications are given as TWO separate consecutive injections. 6) Pull up 150mg/1.5 ml from cilgavimab vial into a 3ml syringe and attach needle for IM administration.(Note: overfill in vial) 7) Pull up 150mg/1.5 ml from tixagevimab vial into a 3ml syringe and attach needle for IM administration.(Note: overfill in vial) 8) Administer the above two medications at different injection sites, preferably one in each of the gluteal muscles (buttocks), one after the other. 9) Observe patient for one hour post-injection--patient to remain in clinic.
